alert.note: Alert for DeSoto (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 20 at 3:18PM CDT by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT NORTHWESTERN DESOTO AND SOUTHWESTERN SHELBY COUNTIES THROUGH 345 PM CDT... At 317 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Eudora, or 8 miles southwest of Horn Lake, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Southaven, Horn Lake, T O Fuller State Park, Memphis, Walls, Lake Cormorant, Southwest Memphis, Lynchburg, Whitehaven, Eudora, Newport, Alden, Twin Lakes, Frees Corners, West Days, Lake View, Glover, Plum Point, Norfolk, and Jago. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
